title: Violence against traditional communities on the rise
description:
Violence against quilombolas, descendants of runaway slaves who formed settlements in remote areas in previous centuries, has increased in recent years in Brazil, according to a study released this Friday by the NGO Terra de Direitos. There have been 62 violent deaths of quilombolas in the last decade – a 55 percent increase over the […]

The post Violence against traditional communities on the rise appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: São Paulo mayor barks at power company, but doesn’t bite
description:
São Paulo Mayor Ricardo Nunes said Thursday that he has asked permission from Brazil’s federal energy regulator to cancel the city’s contract with private power distributor Enel after a massive storm on November 3 left millions without electricity for several days   However, the city hall’s press office would not confirm to The Brazilian Report whether […]

The post São Paulo mayor barks at power company, but doesn’t bite appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Controversial meeting puts Brazil’s justice minister in the hot seat

title: Economic activity in Brazil declines again
description:
The Brazilian Central Bank’s economic activity index (IBC-Br), considered a reliable bellwether for official GDP data, suggests that the country’s economy contracted by 0.06 percent in September from August.  If the economy outperformed expectations in the first half of the year, it has done the opposite in recent months. The IBC-Br also fell short of […]

The post Economic activity in Brazil declines again appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
